Posts.Content: Dec 26, 2012 04:07PM limey wrote: On January 13th 1999, my 31 yr old pregnant daughter was diagnosed with IV breast cancewr, with a single met on the spine.  She had surgery immediately as her spinal cord was threatened, and a lumpectomy.  She was 24 weeks pregnant, and insisted waiting until 32 weeks, when my granddaughter, weighing 3lb 15 1/2oz. was born.  My daughter underwent a ceasarian birth and ovary removal at that time.  Two weeks later she started chemo and radiation. Six years later it returned in her left hip, and she had a hip replacement. Two years ago a spot on her spine, treated with radiation. This year it came back in the same spot, more rads but now it had spread to more places on her spine. Two weeks ago she underwent surgery on her spine, and restarted Herceptin this week. It is 14 years since the original diagnosis, my granddaughter is almost 14 and an honors student, and my daughter remains optimistic about her future. Miracles do happen.  Peace and hope to all of you.
Posts.Title: What do you make of the miracle stories? Skream DivineMrsM
